message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

Reasoning: 
- cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely category as the paper deals with natural language processing and semantic shift detection using contextual embeddings. 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also likely as the paper proposes a new method that uses machine learning techniques to generate time-specific word representations. 
- cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another possible category as the paper deals with the development of an AI model for detecting semantic shift. 
- cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is a possible category as the paper deals with the task of detecting semantic shift in text data. 
- cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a possible category as the paper uses BERT embeddings, which are based on neural networks, to generate time-specific word representations.
